This is our first automatically-generated PR removing deprecations. There are a number of questions I left in comments there, but the main ones to resolve before merging are the following:

  • We deleted the LinearOrdered(Add)CommGroup type classes in this PR, but there are some surviving instances in those namespaces. Should we keep those names or possibly rename them, as @Violeta Hernández suggested? see comment
  • I made a number of changes to Topology/UniformSpace/Defs.lean fixing up a merge conflict with #23181. see comments starting here @Yaël Dillies (or anyone else), I'd appreciate a double check on my choices here.
Would like to note some precedent: in #29084, by request of Yaël, I turned docs#CanonicallyOrderedCommMonoid.single_le_prod into docs#Finset.single_le_sum_of_canonicallyOrdered

OK, I'll see if I can come up with some better names at some point -- however if you or anyone else wants to make suggestions on the PR, I'd greatly appreciate it. (Originally I was hoping these deprecation removal PRs would become a collaborative effort!)
These namespaces may have corresponding class abbrev after lean#8279.
I'd rather keep class abbrev to things like vector spaces, not linearly ordered additive commutative groups.

I think this PR is already doing enough so I just ended up adding a TODO regarding the LinearOrdered(Add)CommGroup namespaces. Other than that I think I've addressed everything, assuming my last commit builds.
This now builds -- reviews / approvals would be appreciated before this picks up more merge conflicts.
I am very much in favour of merging, but given that I have been involved in the process that produced the PR in the first place, I would rather let the decision be taken by someone else.
